## Exercises {#ex}

These exercises accompany the [Intro to Shiny](http://rpubs.com/NateByers/IntroToShiny) tutorial. 

1. If you have not already, create a folder called `ChicagoApp` in your
working directory and place the `ui.R` and `server.R` scripts from the 
tutorial in that folder. Use `runApp()` to open the application.

[Solution](#ex1)

2. Add a table of the data to the bottom of the application. Use
`dataTableOutput()` in the `ui.R` script and `renderDataTable()`
in the `server.r` script.

[Solution](#ex2)

3. Add a Leaflet map to the application with a marker at the location 
of the monitor (latitude 42.14 and longitude -87.79923).

[Solution](#ex3)

4. Replace the `ggplot2` graph with a time series graph from the
`dygraphs` package.

[Solution](#ex4)

### Solution 2 {#ex2}

`ui.R`
```{r, eval=FALSE}
library(shiny)

# Define UI for application that plots time series
shinyUI(fluidPage(

  # Application title
  titlePanel("Chicago Air"),

  # Sidebar with a dropdown for selecting parameter
  sidebarLayout(
    sidebarPanel(
      selectInput("parameter",
                  "Select Parameter:",
                  "Ozone" = "ozone",
                  "Temperature" = "temp",
                  "Solar Radiation" = "solar")
    ),

    # Show a plot of the time series
    mainPanel(
      plotOutput("timePlot"),
      dataTableOutput("dataTable")
    )
  )
))
```

`server.R`

```{r, eval=FALSE}

library(shiny)
library(region5air)
data(chicago_air)
chicago_air$date <- as.Date(chicago_air$date)

  # Define server logic required to plot the time series
shinyServer(function(input, output) {
  
  output$timePlot <- renderPlot({
    ggplot(chicago_air, aes_string("date", input$parameter)) + geom_line() 
  })
  
  output$dataTable <- renderDataTable({
    chicago_air
  })
})
```

```{r, eval=FALSE}
runApp("ChicagoApp")
```

```{r, echo=FALSE}
shinyAppDir(
  "MyApp2",
  options=list(
    width="100%", height=1600
  )
)
```

### Solution 3 {#ex3}

`ui.R`

```{r, eval=FALSE}
library(shiny)
library(leaflet)

# Define UI for application that plots time series
shinyUI(fluidPage(

  # Application title
  titlePanel("Chicago Air"),

  # Sidebar with a dropdown for selecting parameter
  sidebarLayout(
    sidebarPanel(
      selectInput("parameter",
                  "Select Parameter:",
                  "Ozone" = "ozone",
                  "Temperature" = "temp",
                  "Solar Radiation" = "solar"),
      leafletOutput("mymap")
    ),

    # Show a plot of the time series
    mainPanel(
      plotOutput("timePlot"),
      dataTableOutput("dataTable")
    )
  )
))
```

`server.R`

```{r, eval=FALSE}

library(shiny)
library(region5air)
library(leaflet)
data(chicago_air)
chicago_air$date <- as.Date(chicago_air$date)

  # Define server logic required to plot the time series
shinyServer(function(input, output) {
  
  output$timePlot <- renderPlot({
    ggplot(chicago_air, aes_string("date", input$parameter)) + geom_line() 
  })
  
  output$dataTable <- renderDataTable({
    chicago_air
  })
  
  output$mymap <- renderLeaflet({
    library(leaflet)
    m <- leaflet()
    m <- addTiles(m)
    m <- addMarkers(m, lng=-87.79923, lat=42.14)
    setView(m, lng=-87.79923, lat=42.14, zoom = 10)
  })
})
```

```{r, eval=FALSE}
runApp("ChicagoApp")
```

```{r, echo=FALSE}
shinyAppDir(
  "MyApp3",
  options=list(
    width="100%", height=1600
  )
)
```

### Solution 4 {#ex4}

`ui.R`

```{r, eval=FALSE}
library(shiny)
library(leaflet)
library(dygraphs)

# Define UI for application that plots time series
shinyUI(fluidPage(

  # Application title
  titlePanel("Chicago Air"),

  # Sidebar with a dropdown for selecting parameter
  sidebarLayout(
    sidebarPanel(
      selectInput("parameter",
                  "Select Parameter:",
                  "Ozone" = "ozone",
                  "Temperature" = "temp",
                  "Solar Radiation" = "solar"),
      leafletOutput("mymap")
    ),

    # Show a plot of the time series
    mainPanel(
      plotOutput("dygraph"),
      dataTableOutput("dataTable")
    )
  )
))
```

`server.R`

```{r, eval=FALSE}

library(shiny)
library(region5air)
library(leaflet)
library(dygraphs)
data(chicago_air)
chicago_air$date <- as.Date(chicago_air$date)
chicago_dy <- chicago_air[, c("ozone", "temp", "solar")]
rownames(chicago_dy) <- chicago_air$date

  # Define server logic required to plot the time series
shinyServer(function(input, output) {
  
  output$dygraph <- renderDygraph({
    dygraph(chicago_dy[, input$parameter])
  })
  
  output$dataTable <- renderDataTable({
    chicago_air
  })
  
  output$mymap <- renderLeaflet({
    library(leaflet)
    m <- leaflet()
    m <- addTiles(m)
    m <- addMarkers(m, lng=-87.79923, lat=42.14)
    setView(m, lng=-87.79923, lat=42.14, zoom = 10)
  })
})
```

```{r, eval=FALSE}
runApp("ChicagoApp")
```

```{r, echo=FALSE}
shinyAppDir(
  "MyApp4",
  options=list(
    width="100%", height=1600
  )
)
```
